questions.text: Which of the following is not typically considered a method used in "File Analysis" under the MITRE DEF3ND Framework?
Before executing the attacks, PUSIKURAC registers domains through FreeDNS services.Which tactic is being described?
If you perform process injection, i.e., inject code into a running process, what would the resulting digital artifact be?
options: The network logs of the process
The CPU usage of the process
The process ID of the injected process
The file path of the executable
The content of the memory allocated to that process
questions.correctAnswer: The content of the memory allocated to that process

questions.text: Which of the following is not a sub-tactic under the "Harden" tactic in the MITRE DEF3ND Framework?
In network isolation, why do we segment a network?
options: To create firewalls and access controls between segments, so that if one part of the network is compromised, the other segments remain secure.
To allow unrestricted communication between all devices within the network.
To simplify the network design and reduce the need for security measures.
To ensure that all network segments share the same access controls and permissions.
To increase the overall speed and efficiency of the network.
questions.correctAnswer: To create firewalls and access controls between segments, so that if one part of the network is compromised, the other segments remain secure.

questions.text: Which of the following is not typically considered a method of Credential Hardening?
The downloaded executable performs a known UAC bypass through event viewer registry hijacking to gain the highest privileges. What is the recommended defensive measure?
Which of the following sub-tactics is not part of the "Detect" tactic in the MITRE DEF3ND Framework?
In the context of cybersecurity, when does a digital object become a digital artifact?
options: When captured in network traffic and subjected to analysis, elevating it to the level of a digital artifact.
When it undergoes routine monitoring or logging within a secure system.
When stored in a secure environment with restricted access, transforming it into a historical or forensic artifact.
When it is articulated to provide security within a system.
When it is touched, used, or created by a threat actor or defensive actor, transitioning it into a significant digital artifact.
questions.correctAnswer: When it is touched, used, or created by a threat actor or defensive actor, transitioning it into a significant digital artifact.

questions.text: In the context of the MITRE DEF3ND Framework, which of the following cannot be considered a "message" when discussing Message Hardening?
options: Two processes using a message-passing protocol
